###################################################################################

English

Plants vs.. Zombies is a Tower Defence games developed by PopCap Games for Windows, Mac OS X, Xbox Live Arcade and IOS. The player\\\\\\\'s goal is to protect a house from the attacking zombies by planting several different plants. The game was released 5 May 2009 and was made available on steam on the day.

The player will plant various plants, including plants that shoots peas, mushrooms, sunflower (which provides solar energy to plant more flowers) and potato mines in the backyard, the front and on the roof of a house to protect the resident from being eaten by zombies. Plants may be offensive or defensive in nature and differ in their effectiveness against different types of zombies.

The game field is divided into a number of horizontal files, and a zombie approaching only the house without changing lanes (except in exceptional cases) and most plants can only attack or defend themselves from zombies in the same file. When you have killed all the zombies on a path, there are often a reward in the form of a new kind of seeds (plants) that can be used in the future. For each level the player may only select one set of plants that he should be able to plant. The choice is strategic as the various plants can only be placed on the lawn or in the pool and serves a great variety of day or night. In addition, one before each level to see what types of zombies will emerge.


Plants vs.. Zombies have been positive from critics and an overall rating of 88/100 at Metacritic and 88.6% in game rankings. IGN writer Daemon Hatfield said that the game was much richer than similar games and hailed it to be addictive. GameSpot-writer Chris Watters praised the game for the plants and zombies design and overall appearance. But he saw the error of the game learning curve. A review of Edge magazine praised the developers for their ingenuity in every detail and for having made the Tower Defense genre to its own style.

The music video of Laura Shigihara also received praise from Hatfield who wrote on his first interest in the game. 1up-writer Alice Liang also praised the song and wondered how anyone could not take an interest in Plants vs.. Zombies after seeing the video

Plants vs.. Zombies nominated for \\\\\\\"Casual Game of the Year\\\\\\\" and \\\\\\\"Outstanding Achievement in Game Design\\\\\\\" Interactive Achievement Awards from the Academy of Interactive Arts & Sciences. It also received nominations for Best Game Design \\\\\\\",\\\\\\\" Innovation \\\\\\\"and\\\\\\\" Best Download Game \\\\\\\"for the Game Developers Choice Awards. Plants vs. Zombies was elected by Gamezebo to one of 2009\\\\\\\'s best games.
